column4: Is there a photo program that can batch resize photos. I heard Gimp can't do this?
gimp probably can do it, but much as with Photoshop it's more likely to be a total pain in the backside to do
It can? I just spend like 20 min google'n and could not find a "howto"
what to do is use a little bash one-liner to loop over your directory and call convert for every image
I don't know; I would *guess* it can but that's such a backwards way to do it ;-)
how big do you want your images to be?
you want a magic incantation like "for i in *.jpg; do convert $i -resize 320x240 smaller/$i; done;"
that'll loop through all .jpg files in the current directory, make them 320x240 and save them in a sub-directory called "smaller" which you must make before you start
thanks that was really nice of you!
if you're not used to command-line tools it looks a bit scary, but then you realise you can do mindblowingly complex things just by asking
also, "man convert" for the manual, which will tell you more than you could possibly want to know about the options
if you say "320x" instead of "320x240" it will make the image 320px on its longest side, whichever way up it is
OK so I just need the plugin for imagemagic and then use cmd
